result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Cameron X Smith in court, IN CUSTODY.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Cameron X Smith.  Attorney Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 3. Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # Both repeater counts on both counts 1 and 3. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #2 and 4.

Parties request a PSI and an argued sentencing at a later date. Court orders PSI. Bail revoked. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Parties have reached an agreement on plea. The sentencing will be argued after psi. Court will await an email from Atty Khandhar after SAR hearing, to see if anything changes. If no changes the court will set a plea on 10/12 at 1:00 pm, order PSI and set sentencing out.

Court reporter Lynn Schultz. Defendant Cameron X Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Cameron X Smith.  Attorney Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. In court on states motion to amend information. Atty Khandhar does not object. Court grants motion. Court moves forward with arraignment. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Parties have reached an tentative agreement and request a status conference in 30-45 days with the possibility that it will convert to a plea/sentencing hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

11:28 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Payal Khandhar. Attorney Timothy Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Verhoff asks court to find all counts transactionally related. Atty Khandhar presents argument against transactionally relating charges.  Rebuttal by State.  Court grants State's request and finds charges to be transactionally related.  Witness Detective R. F. is called and duly sworn.  Direct exam by ADA Verhoff.  Witness identifies Defn in courtroom.  Cross exam by Atty Khandhar.  State moves for bindover with argument.  Atty Khandhar objects to bindover; waives argument. Court finds probable cause for bindover to Br 17 for further proceedings.  
NOTE:  this case was heard in conjunction with co-defn's case 22CF418
